ED E 321.title: Secondary English/Language Arts Methods
ED E 321.prereq_description: Admission to Single Subject Teaching Credential Program; and consent of
ED E 321.description: Development of pedagogical content knowledge, methods, curriculum design, research, and theory related to teaching and learning English Language Arts at the secondary level.

ED E 321M.title: Secondary English/Language Arts Methods
ED E 321M.prereq_description: Admission to Single Subject Teaching Credential Program; and consent of
ED E 321M.description: Development of pedagogical content knowledge, methods, curriculum design, research, and theory related to teaching and learning English Language Arts at the secondary level.

ED E 341.title: Student Teaching: English/Language Arts Secondary
ED E 341.prereq_description: Admission to Single Subject Teaching Credential Program; and consent of instructor.
ED E 341.description: Supervised fieldwork and student teaching in secondary English/Language Arts classrooms (grades 7-12).

ED E 371.title: Professional Issues in Teaching English/Language Arts:   Secondary
ED E 371.prereq_description: Admission to Single Subject Teaching Credential Program; and consent of
ED E 371.description: Seminar in which teacher candidates in English/Language Arts share and discuss their field experience, explore further avenues of teaching content, and investigate more effective ways of engaging and supporting students.

ED E 391HW.title: ELD/SDAIE Methods and Procedures
ED E 391HW.prereq_description: Enrollment in Multiple Subject Teaching Credential Program.
ED E 391HW.comments: This is a 3-quarter in-progress sequence course with final grades issued upon completion of Ed E 391HS.
ED E 391HW.description: Course focuses on the education of English learners. Primary goal is to prepare professional educators who can articulately advocate for and enact effective educational practices for students who are acquiring English as a new language. Designed to help MST credential candidates begin to develop skills and understanding necessary to make decisions regarding instruction that ensure English language proficiency and academic progress for each student.
